senior systems software engineer, ms network connectivity
san jose, ca or remote


cisco-meraki software engineers breathe life into our cloud-managed devices, which include switches, routers, wireless access, and security cameras. we use real-time telemetry from thousands of networks spanning all over the globe and continuously improve the performance and stability of our products. our incredible growth is a testament to how much our customers love our innovative products.
as a technical leader- systems software engineer, you will develop software that breathes life into our products. you will design, develop and debug high-performance system software & applications. you must be comfortable in taking high-level directions and translate them to actionable steps. you will be responsible for improving and architecting components, bring up new products. your designs should be functional, simple, scalable and always available. you should be passionate about customer experience and driven to triage complex network regressions, improve debug ability.
our projects are driven by innovation and market demand, you will have both structure and freedom to pursue ideas you are most passionate about. in this role, you will have the opportunity to work across teams to craft systems that enable us to solve complex problems for our customers. with millions of people using meraki products all around the world, be ready to make a huge impact.
meraki is headquartered at the mission bay, san francisco, california. come to beautiful views of the san francisco bay. we are also conveniently located at san jose, chicago, austin. we offer flexible work options including remote work.
this position is for network connectivity team at cisco-meraki, come work at the heart of the largest networking company in the world!

organized approach to design, development and quality assurance

who we are

we’re a group of engineers, technologists, designers, and more building products and capabilities that are simple to use and easy to manage. we seek forward-thinking, committed team members who are passionate about new innovative way to deliver value to customers. surrounded by intelligent and creative people who are determined to innovative products and services.

job description – sre manager 

the role: 
a sre manager is ultimately responsible for system reliability, developer productivity and reducing time to market by striving to reduce technical debt of the services your sre team supports. we seek managers who are passionate about system reliability to influence and drive the strategic sre mission.  
as a systems reliability engineer working on critical services your mission will be to ensure our services are fast, highly available, scalable, and able to withstand unprecedented increases in load. the systems reliability engineer will be at the heart of solving production problems. your scope is from the kernel to the application. the position requires the flexibility to take a holistic approach to troubleshooting and the ability to delve deeply into technical details. the systems reliability engineer is co-located with the various application development teams. this ensures the systems reliability engineer will acquire the necessary domain knowledge to effectively troubleshoot and repair an outage. the systems reliability engineer will build automation tools for system health and production acceptance tests to validate production changes. the systems reliability engineer will ensure the system is well instrumented and highly fault tolerant. 
key leadership responsibilities: 
engage, influence, and evangelize sre practices with development, operational and product groups to align technology service/solution delivery. 
drive quality accountability within the organization with well-defined processes, metrics, and goals for process quality. this includes leading effective postmortems and ensuring actions are followed-up. 
manage availability, latency, scalability and efficiency of hybrid cloud offerings by instilling engineering reliability into our development life cycle with a focus on fault tolerant approaches. 
drive capacity planning, performance analysis, instrumentation and other non-functional systems requirements. 
must be able to define and report "progress" on strategic initiates and project level tasks to all stakeholders including senior executives, clients and use effective communication approaches with each constituency. 
implement metrics driven processes to ensure service quality targets are met. 
  who you will work with: 
cisco is transforming its platforms to run the next generation of cloud-native and multi-cloud services. this role offers a superb opportunity to transform how hybrid cloud platforms are managed with full stack automation. this team is responsible to manage hybrid cloud platforms that provides self-service provisioning and management capabilities to the application developers, and at the same time is highly available with self-healing, full lifecycle monitoring and management capabilities. 
you will be part of the cloud infrastructure and platform services team leading a team of infrastruc

job_title: Senior Full Stack Ruby on Rails Engineer
job_desc:
at cisco meraki, we know that technology can connect, empower, and drive us. our mission is to simplify technology so our customers can focus on what's most meaningful to them: their students, patients, customers, and businesses. we’re making networking easier, faster, and smarter with technology that simply works!
the switch dashboard team is a high-impact, fast-paced, growing team that is responsible for our meraki switching product. the switch team is constantly challenged with impactful problems touching areas like scaling, security, cross-product compatibility, etc. our product dashboard teams are small, fast-moving teams striving to make our products unique in balancing their feature-rich abilities and their simplicity. our full-stack engineers are well versed in a wide array of cs concepts and excited to jump around languages, platforms, and all levels of the meraki stack!
example projects of a senior full stack engineer:
developing the tools by which our customers configure and monitor network devices all over the world.
collaborate with peers to design, plan, and build new core product features for our customers.
you will construct intuitive and powerful workflows to solve important problems for it professionals around the world.
responsible for crafting and building some of the high-impact technology projects.
involved in resolving some of the complex scale-related problems
accountable for the stability of our product with a high customer focus.
share your knowledge by giving brown bags, tech talks, and evangelizing engineering standard methodologies.

job_title: Lead Full Stack Ruby on Rails Engineer
job_desc:
you care deeply about creating a fun and supportive team culture, where everyone is encouraged to grow and learn from a group with a diverse set of backgrounds.
you like thinking about systems and architectures — their edge cases, failure scenarios, and lifecycles. you’re interested and experienced in making systems more resilient and fault tolerant.
experienced with ruby on rails. you’ll be making a lot of architectural and design choices specific to rails . you’re pragmatic when it comes to languages and technical decisions and embrace the idea of being language-agnostic.
have 5+ years of experience writing professional production code
have 3+ years of experience in building rich web uis with react (and redux) or similar frameworks
can implement efficient database design in a relational database (we use postgres)
have experience prototyping, shipping, and iterating on new and sophisticated features and experiences
strategic and product-oriented approach with a desire to understand users
thrive within a small team and are excited to seek solutions to open-ended problems
bonus points for:
experience or interest in networking
experience building cloud-based infrastructure and services (e.g. web applications).
to give you a taste of what you could be learning in your time here, our tech stack:
ruby (rails, eventmachine, unicorn), scala (jetty, akka, netty), go
git, gerrit, gitlab, jenkins, teamcity, ansible
postgres, littletable (our custom time-series database that stores 100 of tb’s of data and is written to millions of times a second), elasticsearch, redis
debian, ubuntu, openstack, aws, docker, kubernetes, terraform
grpc, protocol buffers
elk, graphite, grafana, prometheus
maven, sbt, artifactory, nginx
life at cisco
we are passionate about building real products that our customers love. we are confident you will love it here.
as a cisco meraki employee you can expect:
a supportive and fun environment and management that values your contributions and helps you grow; regular career conversations.
a lot of opportunities for professional and personal growth via employee-led groups and mentorship programs. check out one of our groups — women of meraki on twitter and instagram.
paid time off to volunteer (10 days a year), and much more.

job_title: Senior Full Stack Ruby on Rails Engineer
job_desc:
at cisco meraki, we know that technology can connect, empower, and drive us. our mission is to simplify technology so our customers can focus on what's most meaningful to them: their students, patients, customers, and businesses. we’re making networking easier, faster, and smarter with technology that simply works!
the switch dashboard team is a high-impact, fast-paced, growing team that is responsible for our meraki switching product. the switch team is constantly challenged with impactful problems touching areas like scaling, security, cross-product compatibility, etc. our product dashboard teams are small, fast-moving teams striving to make our products unique in balancing their feature-rich abilities and their simplicity. our full-stack engineers are well versed in a wide array of cs concepts and excited to jump around languages, platforms, and all levels of the meraki stack!
example projects of a senior full stack engineer:
developing the tools by which our customers configure and monitor network devices all over the world.
collaborate with peers to design, plan, and build new core product features for our customers.
you will construct intuitive and powerful workflows to solve important problems for it professionals around the world.
responsible for crafting and building some of the high-impact technology projects.
involved in resolving some of the complex scale-related problems
accountable for the stability of our product with a high customer focus.
share your knowledge by giving brown bags, tech talks, and evangelizing engineering standard methodologies.
you are ideal for this role if you :
have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field or equivalent experience
have 5+ years of experience writing professional production code
have 3+ years of experience in web backend technologies, like ruby on rails
have 3+ years of experience in building rich web uis with react (and redux) or similar frameworks
can implement efficient database design in a relational database (we use postgres)
have experience prototyping, shipping, and iterating on new and sophisticated features and experiences
strategic and product-oriented approach with a desire to understand users
thrive within a small team and are excited to seek solutions to open-ended problems
bonus points for:
experience or interest in networking
experience building cloud-based infrastructure and services (e.g. web applications).

job_title: Meraki Network Support Engineer, Japanese Speaking
job_desc:
at cisco meraki, we know that technology can connect us, empower us, and drive us. by simplifying powerful technology we can free hardworking people to focus on their mission. as the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products, and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed it a reality.
as a network support engineer, you will be responsible for providing quality technical support for our growing client and partner base. you will diagnose problems and work with the entire meraki product line, including our wireless access points, security appliances, switches, cameras, meraki dashboard backend, software products, and future releases. our support engineers are foremost problem-solvers passionate about networking, and we seek tech-savvy individuals to build upon our expanding cloud networking group. this customer-facing role will expose you to a diverse group of teams within meraki including; engineering, product management, sales, operations, training development, and strategy - providing endless opportunities for career growth in a lively, exciting, and fast-paced environment.
characteristics of success in this role include previous experience in supporting or testing lans, vlans, vpns, nat devices, or dhcp servers; experience installing and solving wifi networks; and having the ability to multitask and work under stress. we're looking for people who take pride in doing excellent work, and can both guide and learn from those around them.
responsibilities
optimally communicate with third parties such as partners and customers regarding technical issues and customer service inquiries, primarily over the phone and in writing.
troubleshoot and diagnose wireless, security, switching, and other various network-related issues reported by cisco meraki customers and partners.
own each customer case from initial creation to resolution.
collaborate with other support team members to fix network outages, misconfigurations, and sophisticated networking issues on customers' devices.
read and analyze packet captures using wireshark.
work with engineering and management to diagnose and resolve critical, escalated issues.
understand and utilize unix console commands to troubleshoot and diagnose meraki devices and meraki dashboard services.
use acquired knowledge to suggest, edit, and write in-depth knowledge base articles.
stay up to date on meraki features and technology by completing instructor-led and self-paced training modules, participating in engineering and product team communication, and keeping up with enterprise and cloud networking trends.
qualifications
native or fluent japanese
fundamental understanding of and hands-on experience with network technologies including firewalls, content filters, routing/switching, vlans, vpns, and 802.11a/b/g/n/ac wireless.
detailed comprehension of fundamental networking protocols including tcp, stp, arp, dns, ethernet, ospf, etc.
experience supporting or testing lans, vlans, wlans, vpns, nat devices, &/or dhcp servers.
outstanding english language written and verbal communication skills and comprehension.
ability to clearly and concisely articulate both technical and non-technical concepts to third parties.
outstanding customer service skills.
excellent time management, follow-through, and attention to detail.
experience in computer networking related problem solving, critical thinking, and troubleshooting.
ability to multitask and work under stress.
working towards or have a bachelor's degree in computer information technology, information and computer technology, networking and it security, or a related field from a credible university. complete degree vital to begin work.
networking certifications a plus: ccna, ccnp cwna, etc.

at cisco meraki, we know that technology can connect, empower, and drive us. our mission is to simplify technology so our customers can focus on what's most meaningful to them: their students, patients, customers, and businesses. we’re making networking easier, faster, and smarter with technology that simply works.
the modern world runs on the internet, and the internet cannot exist without its underlying infrastructure. meraki makes setting up, managing, and maintaining that infrastructure easier than it has ever been before. meraki enables connectivity everywhere from neighborhood cafes to education institutions to global hospitality groups operating thousands of sites.
the opportunity:
you are an inspiring innovator, mentor, and coach, conversant and passionate about emerging opportunities. you lead by example and demonstrate excellence in collaboration and communication across engineering teams, with an interest in creative problem solving and a consistent track record for leading and directly chipping in to the launches of new platforms and/or transformational architecture changes. you are proficient at writing code and deploying it into a distributed architecture. you are also an effective spokesperson and champion for engineering teams, passionate about mentoring and developing engineers. you are an inspiring leader and a thorough problem solver who is equally comfortable and capable interacting with technologists as with senior business executives with the ability to articulate the value of the proposed solution. you value simplicity at scale and are dedicated to maintaining a culture of quality, reliability, security, and focused execution.
as a principal engineer you will
you lead by example and are a hands-on architect building systems alongside a team
chipping in significant amounts of production code and providing guidance to more junior engineers for code reviews.
applying advanced analytical thought and judgment to think beyond existing solutions
working with partners to set product vision, define, and deliver on technical roadmaps spanning multiple organizations or teams
providing technical leadership for critical platform and systems development
driving complex projects and leading a team of engineers.
articulating the architectural principles for saas-based capabilities
leading strategy and development in distributed large-scale cloud-native technology stacks
incubating, conceptualizing, planning, designing, and leading entrepreneurial projects
working in distributed architectures and working with data structures and algorithms
building and deploying critical, 24x7 solutions in a saas environment
experience building and operating services (microservices) in a distributed system.
problem solving, debugging, and troubleshooting with advanced development skills
architecting and validating solutions which address the identified security challenges
we are looking for:
you have 15+ years of related experience and are recognized as a strategic problem solver in internal and external forums, with extensive technical, market and business expertise.
experienced with modern application development methodologies (ci/cd, agile/devops)
ability to get consensus and set technical direction across a large engineering organization
experienced in building from scratch and/or evolving large web applications
deeply skilled in full stack web technologies and languages (e.g. javascript, react, ruby/rails, scala)
experienced in building systems that operate performantly at scale
familiarity with distributed systems development, container & container orchestration technologies
experience working and helping build test automation systems, deployment pipelines
meraki is based in the mission bay area of san francisco, with beautiful views of the oracle ballpark and the bay beyond. you will have access to an onsite gym, multiple kitchens stocked with high quality snacks, a coffee bar, catered lunches every day, and a generous benefits package.

but “digital transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
day to day, we focus on the give and take. we give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our dna.) we take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

job_title: Full Stack Software Developer (Graduate) – Krakow, Poland
job_desc:
a final year student or recent university graduate with a computer science or computer engineering ba degree or equivalent, who wants to become a software engineer with day-to-day responsibility of working with technical leads to develop and deliver assigned programs. your passion is creating delightful user experiences, building products customers want and use.
you love test-driven development and strive to add automation as you continue to improve efficiency and quality. you enjoy staying on top of fast-moving trends in software development.
you produce high quality code: correct, efficient, testable.
you are an active learner on a journey to solve problems for our customers.
you are fluent in english and have strong verbal, written and presentation skills.


essential technical skills

practical knowledge of python and/or nodejs.
understanding of application performance tuning and resource usage.
understanding of git, automated testing, and continuous integration.
ideally a basic understanding of docker and kubernetes.
understanding of 12-factor apps design patterns.

essential professional skills

excellent verbal and written communication skills in english is a must.
collaboration with other engineers and groups to improve end-to-end consumption of the created capabilities.
a very high degree of autonomy. self-learning and problem solving are expected.
you enjoy working in a team and collaborating on projects and codebases.
looking for “what is in it for them”, demonstrating an understanding of both technical as well as business aspects in everything you do

who you will work with

cisco’s customer experience (cx) organization is one of cisco’s fastest growing teams, transforming how cisco thinks about delivering value to our customers & partners via our product portfolio. the customer and partner experience(cpx) organization is the team that is in the epicenter of developing modern, cloud native technologies in support of the evolving cx product portfolio.

you will work with broadly cross-functional teams to achieve integrations with various groups in cx and business entities.

we believe in building strong teams based on excellence and collaboration and look for people that feel the same.

you and your teammates believe in healthy discussions around ideas and how to deliver quality solutions to our customers. you will be part of a small team that engages in constructive conflict around ideas.


cisco

is it meaningful to you to work for a company that values employees?

#wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (37 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

technologies, and data migration

job_title: Senior Software Engineer- C Programming, Linux, Networking
job_desc:
:
we require creative and hard-working working engineers with high-quality networking products on schedule, with good communication and partnership skills, and a passion for innovation.
in this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing new features, as well as maintaining existing features and areas.
5+ years’ experience in developing in c, multi-threading and problem-solving skills
hands on data structures, operating systems and data networking fundamentals
exposure to data centre technologies.
exposure to development of large/complex network devices including routing & switching systems.
experience in development of layer 2 (ethernet) and/or layer 3 networking protocols including routing, ipv4/6 (unicast/multicast)
expertise in working with linux kernel/os
built and committed software for open source in linux kernel/os/system software
expertise in developing software for complex multi-threaded real time systems
experience in any cisco os – xr, xe or nxos would be a plus
rtos internals, high availability, ipc, memory management, distributed communications infrastructure, serviceability, linux, containers, virtualization
ability to build and work on solutions independently.
demonstrable ability to work with technical interfaces in multi-location, across business units.
willing to excel in teams spanning geographies and physical boundaries
quick learner who is resolved and has a passion to excel

who we are
the name thousandeyes was born from two big ideas:  the power to see things not ordinarily possible and the ability to collect insights from a multitude of vantage points. as organizations rely more on cloud services and the internet, the network has become a black box they can't understand.   our internet and cloud intelligence platform delivers the only collectively powered view of the internet, cloud and saas platforms, helping enterprises and service providers work together to identify problems before it impacts revenue, damages brand reputation, or halts employee productivity.
in august 2020, cisco systems completed the acquisition of thousandeyes, which now forms the thousandeyes business unit within cisco’s network services business group, and is a foundational component of cisco’s growing observability business.
what you'll do
you'll be working in the endpoint team, our goal is to ensure our customers have unparalleled ability to quickly troubleshoot issues and do long-term analysis of end-user experience. we equip our customers with complete visibility into end-user connectivity, wherever they may be located, whether internal or cloud apps. 
our web application is the central customer-facing piece of all our product offerings, used daily by operations teams around the world. we are looking for talented engineers focused on our front end stack who can build new features while keeping the user interface simple and elegant.
what we’re looking for
an experienced software engineer with excellent knowledge of computer science fundamentals.
someone comfortable working with newer technologies and up-to-date with current and emerging web standards.
expertise in javascript development.
experience with vue.js, angularjs or reactjs (we’re currently using vue)
desirable
familiar with jvm based languages such as java, kotlin and/or scala, or other object oriented programming languages.
familiar with docker, kubernetes and cloud technologies such as aws.  
a bachelors degree in computer science or similar.
 why cisco
#wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do –you can’t put us in a box! but “digital transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

job_title: Technical Engineer - Platform Infrastructure/Embedded/OS- Device Driver - 8 to 11 years
job_desc:
:
you have: 7yrs - 12yrs exp
 be/b.tech/me/m.tech/ms  in cs/ee/it/ece, mca, or similar education.
 experience in embedded firmware development
 expertise in os internals and device driver development on distributed & real-time embedded systems and os like ios, psos, vxworks, linux, etc.
 low-level programming (interaction with hardware) using c language in multi-threaded, multi-processor, highly-available systems.
 strong background in linux internals and hands-on experience in virtualization technologies (kvm, vmware) is an added advantage.
 understanding of various h/w architecture (*pci, pcie, dma, i2c, spi, etc.) and *processors (x86, ppc).

 excellent communication skills and a proven record to lead contending high-priority tasks.
 ability to interface and interact directly with various stakeholders, business partners, and vendors
 dedication to customer success: reproduction and debugging of customer issues, handling of field queries. participate/lead in deployments and certifications
 develop functional specifications, assess task requirements and scheduling, and participate in the development, debugging and support
 excellent verbal/written communication skills, collaboration and interpersonal skills.
 good understanding in soc architecture, hardware/software partitioning
 deep c programming language knowledge that allows understanding of kernel and driver level code.
 good understand open source development methodology and practice
 additional os skills will be addon:
 hands-on experience with virtualization technologies, various hypervisors, system software, networking, and have experience with linux kernel software development
 hands-on experience in various board bringups & worked on intel architectures

we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who are prepared to assist in creating new software applications and work alongside other software engineers. as a software engineer, you will need to know how to properly utilize many different programming tools such as python, java, javascript, css, html, and other tools to help improve our business strategies. you will also need to know how database applications are used with our software development plans. having experience with different cloud-based applications and practicing secure computing would be beneficial for the position. we require applicants to have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, a related field, or relevant work experience.

job_title: Software Engineer - C| Linux | Networking (8 to 15 years)
job_desc:
excellent quality is what drives you. to ensure this, you have a thorough understanding of distributed/centralized hardware architectures of routers/switches. your concepts are strong and you have a good knowledge of l2, l3, and mpls protocols and forwarding infrastructure. you possess the necessary skills to work in a highly collaborative, inclusive, and agile atmosphere in partnership with multi-functional teams.

- experience: 9-15 years

- bachelor's degree in cs/ee/ec or technical equivalent.

- ability to write good software in c.

- experience with real-time o/s (vxworks, psos or ios, linux, etc.)

- expertise in using unix/linux development tools, and linux virtualization.

- experience in network processor programming, posix thread programming.

- excellent knowledge of tcp/ip fundamentals, multicast protocols, network synchronization, segment routing, sdn, manageability (telemetry, grpc, netconf/yang, etc.)

services team: if the opening is for the services team, you should have good knowledge about network security protocols like ieee 802.1x, ieee 802.1ae, nat, ipsec etc having working knowledge in areas like qos, netflow and openflow will help you quickly integrate with the team and its mandate.

forwarding team:
good understanding of bridging and routing fundamentals. working knowledge of unicast and multicast packet forwarding for both bridging and routing cases. good understanding on campus or enterprise network deployment architectures. hands on experience in development of l2 or l3 control plane protocols like stp/rstp,udld, igmp, rip/ospf/bgp/isis, bfd, pim/mld. hands on experience in configuring and solving data plane features in asics.

#wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team on innovative technology and powering a more inclusive future for all. how do we do it? well, for starters – with people like you!

we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their businesses. sure, we’re a company that’s 35 years strong and maybe you’ve heard we’re a hardware company. but we’re also a software company. a security company. an ai/machine learning company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns, and protects. and we’re the tech behind keeping the world connected, productive, and ever adapting in our hybrid world by way of webex.

day to day, our teams have each other’s backs. we tackle whatever challenge comes our way, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. we celebrate one another – from big life moments to big career moments. and giving back is in our dna (we get 5 days off each year to do just that too)!

what’s powering an inclusive future for all look like? we know that without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. our 30 inclusive communities are leading the way, and together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, and supporting the most vulnerable through our innovation, amazing culture, and a collective effort to make this world a better place. 

so, you have colorful hair? don’t care. tattoos? show off your ink. like polka dots? that’s cool. pop culture geek? many of us are. passion for technology and world changing? be you, with us! #wearecisco

site reliability engineer

internship (sept - may/june, full-time work schedule, monday - friday / 40 hours)

cisco meraki business unit
as a site reliability engineer intern/co-op on the meraki backend infrastructure team, you will work on projects responsible for everything from our server hardware and operating systems to tools for code deployment and service monitoring. you will have the opportunity to build software and systems to monitor, scale and deploy our distributed cloud services.

meraki's backend infrastructure team is responsible for building and scaling the cloud that supports millions of meraki devices across the world. meraki’s customer base has grown by a factor of 2-3 every year, serving more than 1.5 billion http requests per day across six data centers. our customers depend on the meraki cloud to manage and monitor their critical infrastructure of network switches, security appliances, wireless aps, security cameras, and phones.

in this role, you will be part of a small engineering team that is based out of meraki’s sydney headquarters. during your time here, you will make crucial decisions about how to manage and scale complex, high-performance distributed systems. you will also provide your own perspective on our backend systems and help develop innovative ways to improve the way we manage the underlying infrastructure.

what we look for in our sre intern/co-op candidates:
3rd year status pursuing a ba/bs in computer science, ece, ee, me or stem related field (in progress), no masters
clear and effective communication skills
proactive learners who can quickly pick up working in multiple frameworks, languages and environments
passionate team players
continually able to learn from experience and eager for feedback
previous internship or large scale project experience
a strong foundation in the fundamentals of computer science (familiarity with networking, data visualization, ruby on rails, c/c++ or an understanding of databases)
  bonus points:
know your way around *nix systems. we run debian.
are familiar with logging and monitoring tools such as graphite, grafana, logstash, elasticsearch, statsd, collectd.
  projects and work life:
meraki interns and co-ops join the team for 12 and 16 week programs, respectively, and are placed directly onto subteams. during the program, interns/co-ops have the opportunity to work on a small starter project, such as integration and implementation of new tools, before spending the majority of the program on a larger project, such as building the infrastructure for a new service. projects are cross functional, which allow insight into new languages and technologies, help encourage professional growth within engineering, and allow a sense of ownership within the team.

meraki’s engineering teams place a high emphasis on mentorship. each intern and co-op is matched 1:1 with a mentor who provides continual feedback and guidance throughout the duration of the program.  mentors help with introductions to other team members, overviews of tools and processes, and provide a seamless integration into meraki life.

examples of past projects
adding at-rest encryption to our cloud-based database backups
revamping our organization move process to move customers between servers
implementing docker containers to move our infrastructure to a containerized world

at cisco meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. when we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. we’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.

what you'll do

you'll develop core software technologies at the heart of tomorrow's leading infrastructure solutions, tackling the entire range of challenges from user-facing api-s, through high-level algorithms, all the way down to firmware.
the cisco silicon one team develops breakthrough next-generation silicon products.
if you're looking to work with amazing people, developing the first iteration of world-class products, join us!

in this role, you will:
design and develop software driving the world's most complex infrastructures
gain intimate knowledge of world-class silicon and programming models
work with architecture and design teams to define the next generation of asic products being developed

who you'll work with
you'll be joining cisco silicon one team which is the center of cisco’s sw and asic design.
you'll be part of our group driving our game changing next generation network devices - cisco silicon one™. our unique team works in a startup atmosphere inside a stable and leading corporate.
our r&d center is very unique - hosting all silicon hw and sw development disciplines inside one site.
we are transforming the industry and building a new internet for the 5g era, providing a unified, programmable silicon architecture that is the foundation of all cisco's future routing products.
our devices are designed to be universally adaptable across service providers and web-scale markets, designed for fixed and modular platforms. our devices deliver high speed without sacrificing programmability, buffering, power efficiency, scale or feature flexibility.

cisco silicon one™ is a revolutionary, ground-breaking technology for our customers and end-users for decades to come! the internet now has a new faster, better, safer engine!

who we are
our team develops the full software stack enabling the leaba asic. join a team of talented engineers with a proven track-record at delivering breakthrough products.
you have a unique opportunity to join this team at an early stage and work with us to design and deliver breakthrough technologies.

#wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
but “digital transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
day to day, we focus on the give and take. we give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our dna.) we take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

job_title: Senior Cisco Security Support Engineer - VPN
job_desc:
tac engineers work on sophisticated and in-depth networking problems requiring strong analytical, problem solving, engineering, and social skills. engineers will receive continuous technical training along with training in adaptive troubleshooting methodology. in addition to ongoing training, you will have access to the tac labs with over $650m in inventory containing all cisco products. if you're looking for a dynamic, high impact environment where you will directly chip into the success by deploying and applying the latest groundbreaking networking technologies, then this is the role for you! you will see a wide variety of real-world customer networks and be constantly challenged to expand your networking knowledge and ability to solve problems. this position will provide you with the opportunity and the resources to become a true networking expert when combined with your drive and motivation.
  job responsibilities:
you work closely with cisco customers and strive to provide consistent, high-quality support to ensure the best customer experience. individual responsibilities will include diagnosing and providing solutions to technical problems around cisco vpn solution on all supported products. for the situations that requires developer engagement, you will advance those requests to cisco developers for investigation and submitting defects if identified. a usual day will be working with customers to provide technical updates, performing log analysis using tools built by cisco, reproducing the customer problem in lab, carry out root cause analysis to identify the trigger and potentially working with developers. this role will require you to support weekends and public holidays on a rotation schedule.
  desired skills:
3+ years of related experience involving high level customer support in security technologies
working experience of vpn on different products like cisco router, firewalls – asa/ftd
knowledge and troubleshooting experience of site2site, dmvpn, ipsec, flexvpn / ike, ravpn, getvpn
experience with using wireshark to analyze captures for troubleshooting
fluent in english, written and spoken
    why cisco tac?
the cisco tac team works on real issues with some of cisco's top customers. it's a superb opportunity to master the newest technology and products, while working with a technically diverse and encouraging team. grow your skills in a dynamic, team oriented environment and join some of the industry's top talents in deploying and supporting today's most sophisticated internet technologies.
we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
#li-hybrid

please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. this exact role may not be open today, but could open in the near future. when you apply, a cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.


empowering the world to reach its full potential, securely—that’s our vision in cisco secure. we do this by providing effective security solutions and becoming our customers' most trusted partner. security is everything in a world of evolving threats.
  over the next few years, we’re making big investments for a 10x better customer experience and big growth in cisco secure. here’s where you come in: it starts with building a best-in-class saas sales team with a passion for our customers. come join us, and let’s build the future together. 
 

what  you'll do...
   
as an  account development representative (adr) for duo security, you will rally alongside a team of highly motivated adrs to build a qualified pipeline of potential partners. this includes prospecting partners by phone, email, linkedin or whatever it takes to get them passionate about and engaged with duo! you will not only be responsible for prospecting but will also be expected to be a subject matter expert of all things duo (since you will be the face of the company).
    duo is  cisco’s  trusted access security and multi-factor authentication delivered through the cloud. our team is our secret weapon. we run the spectrum from artists to analysts, low-key to high-energy, and bring together a diversity of skill sets, experiences, and perspectives to solve what we consider to be the world's most pressing geopolitical challenge — transforming the security industry as we know it. together we build solutions that are easy, effective, trustworthy, and enduring. and that’s why we are the most loved and trusted 
security
 solution
.
 don’t worry though, we’re not hanging you out there to dry without support! we have tons of tools and training that will help set you up for success and keep you there, including sales boot camp, ongoing product training, lunch with our lab's team (
i.e.
 security experts), shadowing opportunities, and a stellar group that will cheer you on
.

 

 
skills you have...
       ◦ any sales and or lead generation experience is a plus 
   ◦ a bachelor's degree
   ◦ tenacity and a hunter mentality
                you are self-aware and open to trying new things
   ◦ you thrive on learning and welcome mentorship
    
 
3 reasons why you should apply…
    ◦ you love the thrill of the hunt!
      ◦ you have a proven track record of exceeding your goals
   ◦ you want to be part of one of the fastest-growing saas companies in the world and know that you have the ability to impact the outcome
   why cisco?
  #wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all. 
    
we

you have experience in developing knowledge of mission drivers and trends of the various vertical markets, and how cisco solutions add strategic value.
participating and driving in market access initiatives working in conjunction with the apjc sd-wan sales directory and management team
you will know how to establish relationships built on trust and dedication and develop relationships at multiple levels within customer accounts and understand the customer's business model and help the team identify an architecture and/or solution that provides return on investment. you will have an advanced understanding of internetworking industry trends, including new products and solutions. you will have an advanced understanding of product and solution landscape and can articulate trade-offs between cisco and competitor products
you will know how to develop team members’ capabilities in support of individual career goals and team objectives
have good foundational knowledge of sd-wan and adjunct complementary technologies, including sase.
understand the value of standard methodologies and apply methodologies and other tools to drive business results.
communicate a clear vision and strategy for that encourages and empowers members to execute within a common framework
able to get things done without direct line authority; able to exercise personal influence, resolve conflict, and bring about required behaviours
translate cisco's vision for the future into a compelling value proposition for the team
build the capabilities needed to deliver the team's short and long term goals, including identification and development of a strong pipeline of the best talent from both internal and external pools
support team members by providing transparency and information during organisational changes
clearly and succinctly convey information and ideas, including experienced executive communication and presentation skills.

our minimum requirements for this role:
b.s. degree preferred
extensive proven experience recommended both in sd-wan architectures and management experience.
understanding of apjc markets and sp influence
international management experience preferred.

we are cisco
#wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. here’s how we do it.
we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. a blockchain company. an ai/machine learning company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
but “digital transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
day to day, we focus on the give and take. we give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our dna.) we take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
so, you have colorful hair? don’t care. tattoos? show off your ink. like polka dots? that’s cool.

job_title: UI Designer - Product-Led Growth (Can Be Remote - U.S.)
job_desc:
role: product-led growth, ui designer
  the organization
we are emerging technologies and incubations (et&i) at cisco. we are chartered to build the next new business for cisco. to take cisco into new markets, and especially towards new personas - both buyer and user. and like building a startup from the ground up, it’s all about having an entrepreneurial mindset. taking an idea from a crazy thought to a product that solves a critical need, to an experience that delights users and customers. it's about innovation. from 12 months out to 5 years in the future. wearing multiple hats. failing and learning, fast. about challenging assumptions and finding new ways of solving problems. driving form from ambiguity. about creativity. we are looking for entrepreneurs. thinkers. designers. marketers. product led growth experts. business development, sdrs, customer success. product managers, swes, sres. data scientists and ml engineers. yes, we are building the next set of startups with the support of a trusted name like cisco. where else will you get to do this? we are cisco et&i. we run bold, we run agile, and we run ambitious. come create with us.
  the role
as a ui designer in the product led growth team, you will play a key role in the design and development of cisco’s emerging cloud and edge applications. working directly with the principal designer you will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and user researchers, to deliver intuitive, user-friendly interfaces that drive adoption and engagement.
what we're looking for:
a minimum of 3 years of experience in product design, with a strong portfolio showcasing your work
expert knowledge of the figma platform and best-practices to optimize dev handoff
a deep understanding of user-centered design principles and the ability to apply them to solve complex design challenges
excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to come up with innovative solutions
strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams
a keen ability to translate requirements to deliver dev-ready ui components
an eye for detail and a focus on file organization and management
a self-starter who understands how to work alongside multiple stakeholders and wants to continue to learn and develop their craft
a bachelor's or master’s degree in design, human-computer interaction, or a related field is preferred
what you can expect:
work cross-functionally to help the design team deliver ui components from concept to ga product delivery
create wireframes, prototypes, and detailed design specifications that solve complex user
participate in user research and testing to gather feedback and improve the design
help to develop and maintain a consistent design system and style guide
create high-fidelity mockups and visual designs for web and mobile interfaces
design and deliver components and affordances inside the production workflow
  we are cisco
#wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. here’s how we do it.
we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. an ai/machine learning company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

  core responsibilities
support security needs of india-based development teams
work on improving or implementing services to assist with secrets management, threat hunting, 
suggest or develop and implement security control policies and other technical controls to encourage good security practices
ensure we are collecting relevant logs and assisting our security incident response team with use cases and tools for detecting and responding to security incidents
work on authentication, authorization and other identity management-related services and integrations (ldap, okta, sailpoint, aws idm)
support cloud security services such as ldap, splunk, hardened operating system images, ssl certificates 
preferred skills/experience
experience with aws services is required
pursue cloud infrastructure hardening
fundamental understanding of good security practices
operational mindset – this is a team of “doers” working in primary production environments
practical experience with chef and terraform or other similar technologies
  good to have
kubernetes experience, especially kubernetes security experience, is a huge plus.
experience with other public cloud environments and technologies, such as azure and gcp
experience and knowledge of how to work in an agile/scrum environment
industry-related certifications
python scripting
  education
·          bachelors degree in computer science, information systems, information security, or relevant work experience

  #wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
  we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

  #appd_jobs

we are looking for passionate, innovative critical thinkers that thrive in a team environment, not only growing themselves but others around them too. as a senior software engineer, you will be involved in all stages of the software development from design/architecture to implementation and production support. you will have a solid understanding in distributed system principles, best industry practices and have contributed to solving non-functional considerations like scalability, resiliency, communication in previous roles. big part of a senior engineer is to be a team contributor, mentoring junior team members but also bringing outside concepts and ideas from back to the team.

skills that raise our eyebrows
  strong programming knowledge in java. combination of other jvm languages is also beneficial. rough guide is 7 years, but we value quality over quantity
working experience and understanding of threads, synchronization, locks, concurrent programming, and load balancing
deep understanding of modern cloud technologies and design patterns for building "always-up" services. gcp and azure experience is a bonus.
having built and implemented products and services from ground up in the past
can demonstrate the ability to grow others around them by mentoring and identifying work that would support growth of junior team members
working experience and interest in ci/cd pipelines, quality gates and devops in a saas environment

what we use
 tech stack: java 11 doker’ised micro-services deployed on kubernetes. we use kafka for messaging and postgresdb for storage
framework: micronaut and spring
ci/cd: teamcity, sonarqube, black duck

what we offer
 at cisco appdynamics you can have your cake and eat it too. you will get the creative vigour of a medium-sized company with close colleagues and proximity to the decision-makers. at the same time, you will have access to the resources of one the largest technology companies in the world. in appdynamics cloud team, we truly use the latest technology stack with full exposure to all non-functional considerations.

we offer a competitive combination of compensation and benefits including five days to dedicate to volunteer work, a day off on your birthday, good pension benefits, insurances and, of course, joining cisco ireland which has been voted ireland's best place to work for the past 3 years running and best workplaces for women 2021.

 #li-gf1 #li-remote

  the organization
we are emerging technologies and incubations (et&i) at cisco. we are chartered to build the next new business for cisco. to take cisco into new markets, and especially towards new personas - both buyer and user. and like building a startup from the ground up, it’s all about having an entrepreneurial mindset. taking an idea from a crazy thought to a product that solves a critical need, to an experience that delights users and customers. it's about innovation. from 12 months out to 5 years in the future. wearing multiple hats. failing and learning, fast. about challenging assumptions and finding new ways of solving problems. driving form from ambiguity. about creativity. we are looking for entrepreneurs. thinkers. designers. marketers. product led growth experts. business development, sdrs, customer success. product managers, swes, sres. data scientists and ml engineers. yes, we are building the next set of startups with the support of a trusted name like cisco. where else will you get to do this? we are cisco et&i. we run bold, we run agile, and we run ambitious. come create with us.
  the role
we are looking for an experienced interface copywriter to join our product-led growth team. in this role, you will be responsible for crafting compelling copy for our product interfaces, with a focus on helping users understand the value of our software right away you will be part of a collaborative and dynamic team, working closely with designers, developers, and product managers to deliver compelling messaging across our plg projects including ab experiments and growth-driving interface messaging. the role requires someone with experience working on complex saas products, and the ability to nurture users to be informed and inspired.
what we're looking for:
a minimum of 3 years of experience in interface copywriting, with a strong portfolio showcasing your work
experience with product-led growth strategies and a deep understanding of how to use copy to drive user engagement and adoption
excellent writing and editing skills, with the ability to write clear, concise, and compelling copy
strong attention to detail, with the ability to ensure that copy is consistent, accurate, and error-free
a bachelor's or master's degree in english, communications, or a related field is preferred
what you can expect:
collaborating with designers and product managers to understand the goals and objectives of the product
working independently to write clear, concise, and compelling copy for user interfaces, including buttons, labels, error messages, and other interface elements
participating in user research and testing to understand how the user perceives value when engaging with our products
ensuring that the tone and style of the copy is consistent with the product voice and the needs of the target audience
working with localization teams to ensure that the copy is translated accurately and effectively
creating and maintaining a consistent tone of voice library across products

role: product-led growth, designops
  the organization
we are emerging technologies and incubations (et&i) at cisco. we are chartered to build the next new business for cisco. to take cisco into new markets, and especially towards new personas - both buyer and user. and like building a startup from the ground up, it’s all about having an entrepreneurial mindset. taking an idea from a crazy thought to a product that solves a critical need, to an experience that delights users and customers. it's about innovation. from 12 months out to 5 years in the future. wearing multiple hats. failing and learning, fast. about challenging assumptions and finding new ways of solving problems. driving form from ambiguity. about creativity. we are looking for entrepreneurs. thinkers. designers. marketers. product led growth experts. business development, sdrs, customer success. product managers, swes, sres. data scientists and ml engineers. yes, we are building the next set of startups with the support of a trusted name like cisco. where else will you get to do this? we are cisco et&i. we run bold, we run agile, and we run ambitious. come create with us.
  the role
we are looking for a designops specialist to join our product design team. in this role, you will be responsible for implementing and managing processes and tools that support the work of our designers and researchers and collaborating with other departments to ensure that design needs are being met. you’ll need to apply agile methodologies in a design context to come up with innovative solutions to address ever-changing challenges. you’ll play a crucial role in ensuring that our design process is efficient, effective, and aligned with business goals.
what we're looking for:
a minimum of 3 years of experience in designops or a related field
effective collaboration with designers, researchers, and product managers to understand their needs and goals
extensive experience with tools like jira and project management best-practices
strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams
experience with agile methodologies and the ability to support a design team in an agile environment
ability to gather and process stakeholder opinions to drive decision making
a deep understanding of design processes and the ability to optimize them for efficiency and effectiveness
experience working with research, prototyping and product design delivery at scale
what you can expect:
the opportunity to create from the ground up an optimized design process in a complex environment
identifying and implementing processes and tools that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the design team
engagement with all levels and functions of a innovative organization
developing and maintaining a design system and style guide to ensure consistency across products
managing design assets, including design files, prototypes, and specifications
providing training and support to designers and researchers on processes, tools, and best practices
  we are cisco
#wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. here’s how we do it.
we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. an ai/machine learning company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
but “digital transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) 
day to day, we focus on the give and take. we give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our dna.) we take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
so, you have colorful hair? don’t care. tattoos? show off your ink. like polka dots? that’s cool.

job_desc:
:
bachelor's degree required; mba preferred. bachelor’s or master’s degree in marketing/journalism with experience in b2b technology product for developers or engineering/technology background in cs or equivalent.
you love building technical marketing content of all kinds, digital, web, social, thought leadership, and technical product marketing and messaging.
minimum 10 years' experience in the tech industry at a senior level in product marketing, product management, strategy, or consulting role
excellent communications and presentation abilities
strategic, critical but creative problem solver with strong technical and business sense
ability to lead, build and work within cross-functional team environments
deep understanding of software, networking, collab, security, cloud, and virtualization business models and corporate marketing strategy

the role
as a principal product designer in product-led growth you will help us drive user adoption and growth through product experience and value delivery. in this role, you will be responsible for designing intuitive and engaging user experiences that inform and inspire our users with a focus on showcasing the incredible value of our products. you will play a key role in the team, by designing not only intuitive and user-friendly interfaces but implementing a value-led strategy that fosters adoption across a complex product set.
what we're looking for:
a long track record of delivering powerful product experiences, with a strong portfolio showcasing the work
a deep understanding of user-centered metrics and the ability to combine them with design strategies that impact time to value
experience with product-led growth strategies and a deep understanding of how to use design to drive user engagement and adoption
excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to come up with innovative solutions that go beyond traditional component delivery
strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams
experience with complex saas products
exceptional story-telling and narrative creation skills
a bachelor's or master's degree in design, human-computer interaction, or a related field
what you can expect:
the opportunity to work on complex and challenging software products
a collaborative and dynamic team environment
conducting user research to understand the challenges and pain points that users are experiencing that go beyond their in-product experience.
identifying areas where the product could be improved in terms of not only usability to decrease friction but inform and inspire the user to engage further
collaborating with the design team to create wireframes, prototypes, and mockups that reflect any growth improvements including designing features and functions that make the product more valuable to users.
collaborating with the product and development teams to implement the improvements to the product.
creating narratives that support a growth improvement or feature. this could involve creating materials, such as videos and case studies, that showcase the metrics and impact.
the opportunity to mentor designers and foster the vision of designing for growth.

job_title: Principal Growth & Demand Gen Marketing Manager
job_desc:
the organization
we are emerging technologies and incubations (et&i) at cisco. we are chartered to build the next new business for cisco. to take cisco into new markets, and especially towards new personas - both buyer and user. and like building a startup from the ground up, it's all about having an entrepreneurial mindset. taking an idea from a crazy thought, to a product that solves a critical need, to an experience that delights users and customers. it's about innovation. from 12 months out to 5 years in the future. wearing multiple hats. failing and learning, fast. about challenging assumptions and finding new ways of solving problems. driving form ambiguity. about creativity. we are looking for entrepreneurs. thinkers. designers. marketers. product led growth experts. business development, sdrs, customer success. product managers, swes, sres. data scientists and ml engineers. yes, we are building the next set of startups with the support of a trusted name like cisco. where else will you get to do this? we are cisco et&i. we run bold, we run agile, and we run ambitious. come create with us.
  the role
as a principal growth & demand gen marketing manager, you will be responsible to design and execute b2b digital, virtual, and physical growth campaigns for developers and technical audiences in all parts of user journey from demand generation to upsell/cross-sell. the role requires building a product-qualified leads and taking them to mql and sql. looking for someone with deep experience in this field who is organized, independent, with exceptional execution skills, with data analysis abilities.
what we're looking for:
o   a minimum of 6 years of b2b lifecycle marketing experience to design and execute digital campaigns to drive trial signups, onboarding, engagement, upsell/cross-sell, and retention.
o   someone who has build demand gen engine from the ground up or has scaled existing demand gen activities
o   someone who can plan, design, execute digital campaigns on her/his own to drive metrics, and analyze results and present to executives.   
o   requires analytical skills to understand and interpret data and use it to drive campaigns and growth experiments
o   proven success in working with cross-functional teams, such as product, customer success, and sales, to create and execute against shared goals
o   a passion for transforming every customer touch point into a unique and timely experience that increases propensity to buy.
o   experience running successful lifecycle tactics to create virality such as promotions, referral programs, and nurture flows
o   good understanding of full customer journey and design effective campaigns for all parts of the funnel, build digital creative content, test, measure and iterate on media mix and the roi impact using ltv and cac metrics
o   ability to track user behavior through their digital impressions and infer data-driven insights to drive appropriate next best actions.
o   proficient in using business intelligence tools such as mixpanel, amplitude, or looker, etc. for understanding users, with data stored in systems such as snowflake, bigquery or aws redshift.
o   an eye for detail with critical thinking skills to execute efficiently
o   proficient in crm software, marketing automation, email marketing, (hubspot is a plus), social media campaign software and agencies.
o   ambitious self-starter who understands product content, messaging, campaigns, and demand gen.
o   someone who has experience or interest to market to developers in areas such as kubernetes, application and api security, and full-stack observability.
o   strong conversion-oriented copywriting skills aimed at developers, devops and other technical audience
what you can expect:
o   create campaigns that engage and nurture our b2b developer and devops users from learn phase, virtual experiences/demos, trial sign-up, and trial conversion, all the way through to becoming a paying subscriber, and cross sell/upsell.
o    leverage customer data to create relevant customer experiences that drive affinity, reduce time to first value, and drive adoption of cisco products.
o   define key north star and secondary metrics and constantly test, measure, iterate and report campaign performance, by rigorously a/b testing, and optimizing campaigns across channels. understand the journey of product actions to product-qualified-leads that may be handed off to sales for follow ups
o    craft and iterate on messaging that converts free trials into happy, active customers
o   collaborate with our sales, customer success, and growth marketing teams to improve the conversion rates of our teams and business trial accounts
o   work with product teams to craft and launch experiences to onboard and activate users to new product features
o   develop the reports in partnership with our analytics team, that we’ll use to measure program effectiveness and then share your results regularly
o   use email, webinars, in-product prompts and notifications, and special live events to serve content that will educate users, and help them discover features and value within their trial
  we are cisco
#wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. here’s how we do it.
we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. an ai/machine learning company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
but “digital transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) 
day to day, we focus on the give and take. we give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our dna.) we take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

the role
as a principal growth & demand gen marketing manager, you will be responsible to design and execute b2b digital, virtual, and physical growth campaigns for developers and technical audiences in all parts of user journey from demand generation to upsell/cross-sell. the role requires product-qualified leads and taking them to mql and sql. looking for someone with deep technical experience in this field who is organized, independent, with exceptional execution skills, with data analysis abilities.
what we’re looking for:
e a minimum of 4 years of experience in marketing to developers in areas such as kubernetes, application and api security, and full-stack observability. strong conversion-oriented copywriting skills aimed at developers, devops and other technical audience
a minimum of 6 years ofb2b lifecycle marketing experience in marketing technical products & solutions. experience in designing and executing digital campaigns to drive trial signups, onboarding, engagement, upsell/cross-sell, and retention is a must
someone who has built demand gen engine from the ground up or has scaled existing demand gen activities for developers and technical audience.
someone who can plan, design, execute digital campaigns with little guidance   to drive metrics, and analyze results and present to executives.
has advanced analytical skills to understand and interpret data and use it to drive campaigns and growth experiment.
proven success in working with cross-functional teams, such as product, customer success, and sales, to create and execute against shared goals.
a passion for transforming every customer touch point into a unique and timely experience that increases propensity to buy.
experience running successful lifecycle tactics to create virality such as promotions, referral programs, and nurture flows.
good understanding of full customer journey and design effective campaigns for all parts of the funnel, build digital creative content, test, measure and iterate on media mix and the roi impact using ltv and cac metrics.
ability to track user behavior through their digital impressions and infer data-driven insights to drive appropriate next best actions.
